abstract: Bruce C. Ratner must raise more than $500 million over the next four months to build the $4.9 billion centerpiece of his Atlantic Yards development in Brooklyn: the most expensive basketball arena in the United States.
snippet: Bruce C. Ratner must raise more than $500 million over the next four months to build the $4.9 billion centerpiece of his Atlantic Yards development in Brooklyn: the most expensive basketball arena in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Armed with a set of concessions wrung from state officials this week for his Atlantic Yards development in Brooklyn, the developer Bruce C. Ratner faces what may be his most daunting challenge. He is trying to raise more than $500 million over the next four months to build the $4.9 billion project’s centerpiece: the most expensive basketball arena in the country.

headline.main: Ratner’s Atlantic Yards Project Enters a Crucial Period
